He rang the doorbell again, this time softly and calmly. No rush, no impatience. Looking back on it, that moment stuck with himâ€”clear and sharp. He couldnâ€™t believe he had been so clever, even though his mind felt foggy and he was barely aware of his body. Then, just like that, he heard the latch click open. ðŸ”‘

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, in a moment of cunning despite his clouded mind, recalls the vivid moment when he heard the latch of the old woman's door unfastened.
